channel.title: Sentence Generator?
channel.description:
Well every week in school our teacher gives us a list of 10 words or so and we have to turn them into sentences. I mean this is no big deal except for its still time consuming. I was wondering if anyone knew of a website which would make this easier for me by just like entering in the word i need to use and a sentence using that word correctly with proper grammar and such will be generated. If anyone could help me out that would be great.
Thanks, Phatal
[sub]Ok, words this week are: * also note that proper spelling and grammar is needed for full credit, help please :)
dauntless - adj- fearless; that which cannot be intimidated mirthful - adj- full of, expressing, or causing mirth or merry magnanimity - n- ability to rise above pettiness or meanness malignantly - adv- very harmfully; maliciously wanton - adj- senseless, unprovoked, deliberately malicious consternation - n- great fear or shock that makes one helpless or bewildered lamentation - n- outward expression of grief; a weeping or wailing yoke - n/v- symbol of subjection or servitude (neckframe) or to join or coupled by a yoke dudgeon - n- anger or resentment[/sub]

lol its pretty easy to make sentences yourself

tyvm Legit =) hope your up for another 10 next week

item.title: Sentence Generator?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

The dauntless sky-diver leaped into the blue expanse.
He laughed a mirthful laugh at the humorless joke.
James’ magnanimity was clear as he stayed aloof throughout the entire quarrel.
The cancer malignantly spread through Piyush’s arm.
The Punjab’s wanton actions caused much disgust.
After such a consternation, Joanne couldn’t drive properly (the fact that she was a woman may have also played a part).
The Israelites’ lamentations were heard by God, who sent them a savior.
Her yoke was too much to bear; she committed suicide.
I stuck a dudgeon in your mom. He felt the dudgeon build up inside of him as the bullies picked on him.

Read full topic

item.title: Sentence Generator?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

  1. Dave is dauntless
  2. Dave likes mirthful people.
  3. Dave just couldn’t express his magnanimity any furthur.
  4. Dave found out what malignantly meant.
    ect ect

Read full topic

item.title: Sentence Generator?
item.dc:creator: @phatal phatal
item.description:
@phatal wrote:

Ok, words this week are:

  • also note that proper spelling and grammar is needed for full credit, help please

dauntless - adj- fearless; that which cannot be intimidated
mirthful - adj- full of, expressing, or causing mirth or merry
magnanimity - n- ability to rise above pettiness or meanness
malignantly - adv- very harmfully; maliciously
wanton - adj- senseless, unprovoked, deliberately malicious
consternation - n- great fear or shock that makes one helpless or bewildered
lamentation - n- outward expression of grief; a weeping or wailing
yoke - n/v- symbol of subjection or servitude (neckframe) or to join or coupled by a yoke
dudgeon - n- anger or resentment

item.title: Sentence Generator?
item.dc:creator: @Dregen Dregen
item.description:
@Dregen wrote:

Look up each word in an online dictionary, there should be some example sentences to show what the word means. Copy those onto your paper.

Read full topic
